posts.title: Day after SC’s warning, Centre sets up enforcement task force to check Delhi air pollution |10 points
posts.desc: This comes a day after the apex court pulled up the central and state government over the rising air pollution levels in the National Capital Region.

posts.title: Live Cricket Score, India vs New Zealand 2nd Test: Mayank Agarwal scores century as India surpass 200
posts.desc: India vs New Zealand Live Score, Final Cricket Score and Live Streaming, Latest Updates: Mayank Agarwal seems to be in very good touch, especially against the spinners. He goes for the lofted drive, powering the ball over the long-off boundary for a six. The very next ball, Mayank gets four leg byes. Will Somerville won't be happy with how things are going on for him. 12 runs coming off the over.

posts.title: Centre tables Bill to amend CVC and Delhi Police Special Acts in Lok Sabha: Key features of the proposed legislations
posts.desc: The Bills replacing ordinances, seek to extend the tenure of the Central Bureau of Investigation and Enforcement Directorate director up to five years

posts.title: BWF World Tour Finals: Already qualified for semis, PV Sindhu loses final group match, Srikanth bows out
posts.desc: Sindhu, a two-time Olympic medallist, couldn't apply enough pressure on the world No 10 Chochuwong to go down fighting 12-21 21-19 14-21 in a match that lasted an hour and 11 minutes.

posts.title: Audi Q7 facelift to finally be launched in India in 2022, three-row SUV to return in petrol-only guise
posts.desc: The facelifted Audi Q7 is expected to be offered with the same 3.0-litre, 340 hp six-cylinder turbo-petrol engine that powers the Audi Q8.

posts.title: Sri Lanka vs West Indies: Spinners Lasith Embuldeniya, Ramesh Mendis script hosts' 2-0 Test series win
posts.desc: Chasing an improbable target of 297, the West Indies lost only two wickets in the first session and looked determined to save the Test. But in a sensational collapse, they lost eight wickets for 40 runs after lunch to surrender the match

posts.title: Tadap movie review: Ahan Shetty directorial debut hinges on plot twist that's gateway to misogyny
posts.desc: The characters in Tadap have no shades, this makes it even less possible to empathise or sympathise with their predicament.

posts.title: Rupee falls 14 paise to 75.16 against US dollar amid growing worries over new COVID-19 variant
posts.desc: The rupee has been under pressure over the last few trading sessions as the detection of the new coronavirus variant Omicron re-ignited growth concerns and hurt risk appetite.

posts.desc: Last edition runners-up Belgium will face Netherlands, who thrashed Malaysia 9-3 in another classification match, in the fifth-sixth play-off.

posts.title: Resident Evil: Welcome to Raccoon City movie review – Horror beats are accompanied by moments of absurdity
posts.desc: The film is stuck piling character upon character for much of its runtime, while also keeping the zombie-virus threat in the fray constantly.

posts.title: 'Aap ne ghabrana nahi:' Pakistan embassy in Serbia mocks Imran Khan over inflation, demands salary; govt says account hacked
posts.desc: The tweet by the verified account of the embassy mentioned Imran Khan, asking how long does he expect government officials to remain silent in the face of hyperinflation. 'Is this Naya Pakistan,' the post read

posts.title: Deep depression in Bay of Bengal intensifies into Cyclone 'Jawad'; storm to make landfall in Odisha, AP by tomorrow
posts.desc: Sea conditions will remain unsafe for shipping and fishermen in central and north Bay of Bengal from Friday to Sunday.

posts.title: Delhi air pollution: Panel issues new orders to tackle crisis; educational institutes to be shut
posts.desc: All schools, colleges and educational institutions in the NCR shall remain closed, allowing only online mode of education, except for the purpose of the conduct of examinations and laboratory practices, the commission said.

posts.title: Former controversial world athletics chief Lamine Diack dies at 88
posts.desc: Diack, who was president of the IAAF, now World Athletics, from 1999 to 2015, was convicted in Paris in September 2020 on multiple charges of corruption during his tenure
